title: Downloads fell to 0
body:
Hi

A month or so ago my total downloads fell to 0. I've tried deleting all data and resyncing but all of the rest comes in save for the downloads and active installations.

What could be the cause ?

Thanks

Paolo

title: No data ratings text refers to downloads
body:
The first time one installs the app no data is loaded. When you visit the "ratings" tab of a random app there is a text hint shown:

> Andlytics collects data over time. to see a meaningful chart come back as soon as more data is available.
>
> Usually download stats are updated every 24 - 48 hours.

![andlytics-ratings-empty](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/144518/44195824-7d782100-a13a-11e8-87fa-1ab64a900a16.png)

The text should not refer to "download stats" but to "rating stats" since the "ratings" tab is selected as highlighted in the screenshot above.

title: Dev
body:
Made some changes for the stats. Total downloads were removed from the json and I have not found a replacement. Ran out of time but I figured I would submit the code in case someone else wants to tackle it. 

Also this code compiles on AS 3.1.3

title: Loading Error
body: Since 12.06 I get an error message when loading. Is it a known problem?

title: Hi Can I contribute logo or icon for andlytics?
body: ![iconandlytics144x144](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33398323/41545216-4b16e4be-734d-11e8-8541-5285a2816e33.png)

title: Dev
body: Add support for an adaptive icon

title: Adaptive icons
body:
Would you be interested in adding support for adaptive icons to Andlytics?

I've drawn up a couple of versions, [the first](https://adapticon.tooo.io/#/bg=https://imgur.com/download/XV0XoM7/fg=https://imgur.com/download/eQy3FDx) is trying to keep in line with the current logo. [The second](https://adapticon.tooo.io/#/bg=https://imgur.com/download/7dvRwla/fg=https://imgur.com/download/A48aS3a) is my own adaptation. Let me know if you'd be interested in either - I can create a pull request or just attach pngs.

title: Logo design proposal
body: Good day! i would like to submit a logo/icon proposal for application. Please message me if you would like . Hoping for your positive respone. Thank You!

title: Dev
body: Fix for null pointer.

title: Dev
body:
Upgraded to Android Studio 3.0.1
Fixed the issues from January 31st 2018
Added API Level to comments.

title: How to contribute
body:
Thanks for the wonderful app!

We are using Andlytics app for the past two years. We want to contribute to the project by adding more features. We couldn't compile the latest version in github. Is this code same as the one in play store?

body: Fixed the latest issue as of October 18 2017

title: Authentication failed for... : Authentication window does not pop up
body:
My Andlytics installation was working fine, but now flashes up an Authentication failed toast. If I uninstall and reinstall I get the same thing. Normally a window should pop up inviting me to approve Andlytics access to my Google account. That window doesn't pop up though. This is on my Sony Xperia Z Ultra on 5.1.1.

If I install on a different Android device, eg a Blackberry KeyONE, I get the popup as usual and the app works after approving it.

title: Dev
body:
Fix for Play Store Console on July 26 - Feth command
Updated version number and changelog.

title: Play Console Authentication
body:
I want to create an API to be able to fetch information from the Play Console exactly how this app does. However, since it's impossible to run our copy of the app (then no step by step debug is possible) I'd like someone, if possible, to explain how the app authenticate and how it is allowed to access the web page (the only thing I've not figured out yet).

I'll be creating an open-source repo for the API in Java.

Thank you in advance.

title: Failing again, I think maybe the console changed?
body:
I went ahead and submitted the error report. If you need logs I'll be able to get them in a few hours. 
Thanks,

title: No published apps found
body:
I was checking my google account security settings: https://myaccount.google.com/permissions

I noticed that Andlytics had "full access to your Google Account", which is more than any other app has (except Chrome).

I thought (hoped) that perhaps Andlytics may have needed this in the past, but has since made improvements to only request minimum permissions to access Play Store app data.

So, I removed this access in the security settings.

Then I uninstalled Andlytics from my phone and reinstalled it from the Play Store.

I opened Andlytics and selected my Google account: the only one on my phone, and the same one I was using before.  It's not a "Google Apps for Business" account, and not linked to multiple developer consoles.

It displays no apps, and says "No published apps found".

Any clue how I can get this working again?  I saw one other issue (https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues/735)  where somebody had to remove and re-add their Google account on the phone, but I'm hoping I don't have to do that.

title: Warning of Google Play Developer policy violation: Action Required
body:
Got this from Google ! @nelenkov @willlunniss 

-------

Hello Google Play Developer,

Our records show that your app, Andlytics, with package name com.github.andlyticsproject, currently violates our User Data policy regarding Personal and Sensitive Information.

Policy issue: Google Play requires developers to provide a valid privacy policy when the app requests or handles sensitive user or device information. Your app requests sensitive permissions (e.g. camera, microphone, accounts, contacts, or phone) or user data, but does not include a valid privacy policy.

Action required: Include a link to a valid privacy policy on your app's Store Listing page and within your app. You can find more information in our help center.

Alternatively, you may opt-out of this requirement by removing any requests for sensitive permissions or user data.

If you have additional apps in your catalog, please make sure they are compliant with our Prominent Disclosure requirements.

Please resolve this issue by March 15, 2017, or administrative action will be taken to limit the visibility of your app, up to and including removal from the Play Store. Thanks for helping us provide a clear and transparent experience for Google Play users.

Regards,

The Google Play Team

https://play.google.com/about/privacy-security/additional-requirements/
https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/113469#privacy

title: Update project setup
Convert line endings from CRLF to LF.
body:
- This commit introduces no code change!

Please do not commit files with Windows line endings (CRLF) since this causes a permanent **full-file-diff** on *nix machines. The Git config can be setup to automatically convert line endings back and forth on a Windows machine.

> Formatting and whitespace issues are some of the more frustrating and subtle problems that many developers encounter when collaborating, especially cross-platform. It’s very easy for patches or other collaborated work to introduce subtle whitespace changes because editors silently introduce them, and if your files ever touch a Windows system, their line endings might be replaced. Git has a few configuration options to help with these issues.
> 
> `core.autocrlf`
> 
> If you’re programming on Windows and working with people who are not (or vice-versa), you’ll probably run into line-ending issues at some point. This is because Windows uses both a carriage-return character and a linefeed character for newlines in its files, whereas Mac and Linux systems use only the linefeed character. This is a subtle but incredibly annoying fact of cross-platform work; many editors on Windows silently replace existing LF-style line endings with CRLF, or insert both line-ending characters when the user hits the enter key.
> 
> Git can handle this by auto-converting CRLF line endings into LF when you add a file to the index, and vice versa when it checks out code onto your filesystem ...

Source: [Git documentation - Configuration - Formatting-and-Whitespace](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Configuration#Formatting-and-Whitespace)

title: Error in data reporting
body:
Hi,

I have noticed that if the Play Store fails to update finance data daily then the app will log the same revenue as the last reported date as the current date. The Play Store had a 3 day delay until it updated for my finance data and so now the app is reporting 4 days as exactly the same revenue rather than fetching the new data.

Could you implement a historical data fetch so that if such a thing happens we can force it to refetch the data for X amount of previous time. Otherwise if it keeps reporting incorrect data is becomes a bit useless.

Thanks,
Daniel

title: Fix for linked accounts that cannot access apps
body:
Fix for #664 

Not sure about how best to report the problem when it affects some accounts. Currently the only idication that something is wrong if some accounts are allowed but others are not is a log message which is not ideal. But we don't want to notify the user every time as they may not be able to fix it.
This would be solved if we presented each linked account as a seperate account that the user could switch to, but that requries quite a bit of work.

title: Use design time attributes to assist layouting and value preview.
body:
I added [Design Time Attributes](http://tools.android.com/tips/layout-designtime-attributes) which are useful to **render meaningful previews** for the layout files in Android Studio. They also help to optimize layout in general. Further you can **add placeholders** for text and image elements. I use strong **background colors** for text fields and image views to preview their exact dimensions and margins.
None of these changes affects the compiled application code.

Here is an extreme example for _layout/comments_list_item_comment.xml_:
## Preview without Design Time Attributes

![andlytics-without-design-time-attributes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/144518/6328394/40dff7f2-bb67-11e4-8a38-f15706134c4d.png)
## Preview with Design Time Attributes

![andlytics-with-design-time-attributes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/144518/6328397/44fb3324-bb67-11e4-9763-11cd8b8073c6.png)

title: put disk access into background thread?
body:
Hi, I'm doing research on performance for Android apps. I found some event handlers access disk (read/write files, decode bitmap) from UI thread, but Android docs suggest us to avoid such blocking calls in UI thread. Do they lead to any responsiveness issues?

I tried to refactoring by putting them into background tasks. Looking forward to see your comments.

title: Switch to ActionBarCompat

title: Unpublished applications

Updated android support v4 dependency.
Updated gitignore.

title: temporarily disable revnue fetching, see #620
body: Pushed to Play Store as 2.6.1

title: 404 on fetchRevenueSummary
body:
Since yesterday when updating i always get the message "A network error has occured. Please try again later". 

In the logcat i found out, that com.github.andlyticsproject.console.v2.DevConsoleV2.fetchRevenueSummary fails because there is a 404. 

`08-28 15:35:26.368: E/Main(3478): com.github.andlyticsproject.console.NetworkException: Status-Code: 404`

The other URLs are still working, so when not caling the fetchRevenueSummary the app can update again. 

Is this something account-specific or a general problem? I only have free apps in my account.

title: Fixed PR 615
body: Added missing imports so it can build, ensure that new lines are preserved, and ensure that text is displayed properly in the long text dialogs

title: Show application description and change log as html
body: Play Store description and change low support a subset of html tags: http://stackoverflow.com/a/18746972/239438

title: Auth failure
body: For the past few days, Andlytics hasn't been able to log into Google Play. I've tried clearing data and resetting, but no luck.

title: Remove Eclipse/Ant support?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Any thoughts on if/when we should remove support for Eclipse/Ant?

At the moment, we have equivilant versions of libraries/jars in the project, but going forward if we start updating/adding new libraries, are we going to add the jar versions for Eclipse?

We can either:

1) Remove support (and possibly update the directory structure)
2) Leave support in, but don't update libraries/build files
3) Keep supporting Eclipse/Ant

title: Update build tools
body: Updates the gradle based build tools to the latest versions and removes unneeded files

title: UI Enhancements for data Export and Import screens
Enhancement/list view
body: Fixes and all commits purged into a single one.

title: Show listview for accounts in LoginActivity
body:
Show listview for accounts in LoginActivity rather than showing the available accounts as children of a linear layout.

Sorry for some fat commits.

title: Active installations problem
body:
Hello,

Active installations do not correspond at all with google play console. 
There is no longer any relation between the console and the statistics of the application and that for an indefinite period. 
This is an capture of the console play:
![wifiparis](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4151352/3110760/147abed8-e6a9-11e3-8e49-a27d47824cf1.png)
This is an capture of the andlytics:
![screenshot_2014-05-28-22-47-34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4151352/3110799/87e7ad36-e6a9-11e3-962c-93c53a79ade7.png)

Why this difference?

title: Authentication failed (using 2-way-authentication)
body:
I'm using the **2-way-authentication** and it seems, that after 30 days my token was revoked. I got the notification, that my authentication failed, but if I open the mobil page (by touching this notification), everything works fine on the website. 

That's why I think, the stored token is no longer available. Can someone confirm this behaviour?

title: Fake new stats comment update
body:
The past couple of days I've gotten updates on a new comment over 10 times per day. It says +1 but when I click to read it there is no new comment and when I press back the counter is decreased by one usually. Sometimes it's not and then instead in the next update (usually within a few minutes) there is a -1. Only one time during these days I've gotten a real comment, it worked like normal (+1 and there was a comment to read).

I suspect that its not Andlytics fault but that Google is doing something strange.

Couldn't one solution be to compare the "new comment" with the latest and if they are the same, don't show any notification? This would of course not work if the "new comment" is empty.

Anyhow, a solution to this is much appreciated as the before happy feeling of seeing an update from Andlytics has turned into a "noo, not again!".

Cheers

title: Проблема с новым AdMob
body:
При выборе отчетного периода неправильно считает. Правильно показывает только за весь период. 
Да и еще - в главном окне, если количество комментариев выше 4500,то всегда показывается только 4500.

title: Wrong EPC for Admob
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
The admob is showing wrong epc. The EPC is having the same value as Revenue column.
Eg:
Revenue   EPC       Click
USD 10    USD 10    100

The EPC should be 0.1 USD instead of USD 10!

Please fix it as soon as possible. I am still with old Admob.

title: Problème with coments
body: Some comments do not go back into the application. These comments have only a title and no description.

title: Wrong range of rating shown in diagram for average
body: In the case in which the average rating is about 5, the range of the diagram is [3,7] instead of [1,5].

title: ListView items cropping text
body: ListView items do not support text wrapping or multiple lines. This problem may occur only for specific languages (e.g. German). The cropping makes the text within the item unreadable!!!!

title: Missing descriptive headers for tables
body: The tables within the downloads- and rating tabs are not meaningful described by headers or something comparable

title: Diagrams blank if no ratings present
body: If there are no ratings present for a certain time period the diagram is shown blank which gives the user the impression of an error.

title: Need to be able to choose whether to auto-refresh or not when loading the main activity
body:
Need to be able to choose whether to auto-refresh or not when loading the main activity.

With too many apps all you every get to see is the updating spinner. A way to make it refresh only on demand (probably by setting a flag via preferences) would be something nice.

title: improved speed for fetching app information
body:
My main issue with Andlytics is that it takes up to 30-45s to request information for my 10+ apps as it does this one by one.

fetchAppInfosAndStatistics() now runs in parallel rather than one app at a time.
With this patch it takes me about 10-15s.

Sorry for the space removals, it's an Eclipse setting.

title: Replacing ActionBarSherlock with AppCompat
body:
I've done about 95% of the work required to switch it over.
My branch can be found here: https://github.com/twig/andlytics

The 3 remaining activities are the preference ones, which appcompat currently doesn't support (AccountSpecificPreferenceActivity, NotificationPreferenceActivity and PreferenceActivity)

What we COULD do is use https://github.com/kolavar/android-support-v4-preferencefragment, but I thought it'd be a good idea to start a discussion first.

title: Fixed comment parsing, added comment titles
body:
**Example comment (anonymised):**

``` json
{"3":"1392410977213","2":"Jon Doe","10":true,"1":"gp:XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX","7":"1.0.0.0","6":100,"5":{"3":"Booom","2":"Muito bom.","1":"pt_BR"},"4":4,"8":{"3":"Manufactor","2":["Device"],"1":"xxxxx"},"11":{"2":"Very good.","1":"en-US","4":"pt"}}
```

The last part under PARENT:"11" does not contain a CHILD:"3" which would be the translated comment body, but the source, PARENT:"5" has a CHILD:"3" with the text "Booom", which is missing in the translation.
If we google translate from **pt** to **en** source and translation are the same, this could be the explanation.

title: No published apps found
body:
Hi.  I've been using Andlytics for some time now (thanks for your work on this app).

Yesterday, a problem arose when Andlytics would try to update, but couldn't.  No error is given (so no authentication error, force close or anything else) but the figures just wouldn't update.  I tried exporting, uninstalling and reinstalling and I now just have a blank screen with the "no published apps found" error.

I've also tried using Chrome to log in to the developer console, and no CAPTCHA or security challenge comes up.

I can't conveniently get at the logcat (I'm not rooted), but looking in the debug folder the only file of relevance is as below.  The file date is roughly the time the problem started.

console_reply_1389883802021.json

{"error":{"data":{"1":-32600},"code":-32600}}

I was running Andlytics 2.5.6 on the release channel.  I've upgraded to the latest alpha release (2.6.0-alpha5) but there is the same problem.

Many thanks,

Andrew

title: Fixes #467. Add gradle support and use dependencies from maven repo and ...
body:
Added dependencies using maven repository and also using android support repository. 

In order for this to work you need to use the android updater and select android support repository.

For gradle use the gradlew command or install at least gradle 1.9

title: fixes 467, add support for building with gradle
body:
Added support for gradle as i am not using eclipse any more, still works with eclipse.

You need to use gradlew.bat or gradlew depending on your environment, if you just want to use the system gradle version you need to make sure its at least 1.9

Is there a way to switch from auto refresh to manual refresh. A setting for this in the preference would be awesome. :-D

title: New Admob only shows banner names
body:
Hello, 

I have ten apps with Admob integrated, so I wanted to configure it in Andlytics. The problem is, it seems to only show the banner names and according to the Admob example you should name the banners like front page.  So I've done that for all my front pages in my apps. The result is, I see ten times front page in Andlytics and I have no clue which app each banner belongs to. 

The banner names should be changed to app names and all banners should be wrapped together to one graph

title: FR: chronological event view
body:
When I get a notification of Andlytics and click it, it takes me to the overview page. There, I can only see the new ratings/comments/stats for that day. However, when I get 20 ratings per day, it's hard to tell "Which one was the new one? Did I have 5 or 6 comments already?"

A nice feature would be, if the notification would take me to an activity, which lists the latests events like 
"5:33 pm: 5\* ratings +1
5:23 pm: comment: Great app!
...
"

So when the notification shows 3 events, I just need to look at the first 3 lines and know what actually happened.

Data is not updated after time was set incorrecntly
body:
Hi,

I was playing with date and time settings, the date was changed couple of times during the day (+- one month). Andlytics has authentication error that time. After 2.5.6 was released, I've started to receive notifications, but numbers were exactly the same.  After reinstall everything works fine. Probably you are somehow saving date and time.

title: Download report does not include first day's downloads
body: When viewing the download report, the first day's downloads are shown as 0. For example, when you filter it to show downloads for last 7 days, the first day's downloads is shown as 0, and the total is only for the last 6 days. Same is with the 30 day report. This makes sense when viewing all downloads (unlimited), for then it does not have a previous day's totals in order to calculate the first days downloads, hence it's set to 0, but when filtering to last 7 or 30 days, it really does know the previous day's downloads, and it should show even for first day.

title: Small inconsistency: Removed generic Intent i and moved dependencies to ...
body:
......

As commented by : @nelenkov on prior patch: https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/pull/480
"Looks good, but can you please make this against the dev branch? We try not to touch master unless something in the API breaks. It will be merged into master in the next release."

As commented by : @nelenkov on prior patch: https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/pull/479
"Thanks for the patch. However, I don't think this makes it more readable. Getting rid of the Intent i would be better IMHO. It's not like the switch just sets up the intent and it is started at the end of the method -- some cases use startActivity() and others startActivityForResult() so it is better each case to use an explicit, named intent."

title: Small inconsistency: Removed generic Intent i and moved dependencies to ...
body:
...using explicit intents

As commented by : @nelenkov on prior patch: https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/pull/479
"Thanks for the patch. However, I don't think this makes it more readable. Getting rid of the Intent i would be better IMHO. It's not like the switch just sets up the intent and it is started at the end of the method -- some cases use startActivity() and others startActivityForResult() so it is better each case to use an explicit, named intent."

title: Small consistency adjustment for intent declarations and calls in onOpti...
body:
...onsItemSelected

Small consistency adjustment.
Set all intent declarations and calls to use the Intent i that is declared at the beginning of the onOptionsItemSelected method.
Previously, only half of the calls were using Intent i. Now all are.

title: Alpha/Beta tests
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Since we already have a community, we could try pushing beta, etc. (based on dev or some other experimental branch) to people that are willing to register as testers. The community has all of 9 members and not much work has been on the app lately, but still. Right now the only interesting thing is experimental support for revenue display but some people might find it useful. Of course that means that we will get even more bug reports/feature requests about the beta, etc. version.

I've uploaded a totally untested version built off the revenue branch as an alpha version to see how this works. Testers need to be members of the community and register at the URL below to receive an update with the alpha version: 

https://play.google.com/apps/testing/com.github.andlyticsproject

WDYT?

title: AdMob broken due to expired SSL certificate
body:
Syncing AdMob stats has been broken for the last few days because their SSL certificate has expired. Not much we can do about it other than wait for them to fix it, or switch to the http version.

`com.github.andlyticsproject.console.NetworkException: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: com.android.org.bouncycastle.jce.exception.ExtCertPathValidatorException: Could not validate certificate: current time: Sun Jun 09 12:04:37 GMT+01:00 2013, expiration time: Fri Jun 07 20:43:27 GMT+01:00 2013`

Maybe contact them via their twitter account @googlemobileads /any other suggestions for getting in contact with them?

title: Implement an 'API' status endpoint
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Add a static JSON document to dropbox, or somewhere on GitHub which the app can query when it detects a problem with fetching data. This would contain the last update date, status, latest app version, and maybe a bit of text description as well if its a specific problem.

Status could be something like `FIX_PUBLISHED, PROBLEM_REPORTED, PROBLEM_IDENTIFIED, FIXED_IN_DEV` or similar.

We can they use this to inform uses about whats going on, and cut down on the number of emails/bug reports/comments when we have enough information to fix it, have fixed it.
- [ ] Decide on the required data/structure
- [ ] Implement the 'server' end
- [ ] Implement the client end in the app

This is a realy great app. I hope this will be fixed..
Thanks, Dvir Cohen.

title: Attempted read from closed stream in DevConsoleV2.post
body:
Hi,
I am getting an "java.io.IOException: Attempted read from closed stream." exception in DevConsoleV2.post(String url, String postData, String developerId), I was trying to fetch for app data and it threw an exception on the following line:

return httpClient.execute(post, responseHandler);

i am not running from an android, but integrating this into my own server, so I got the SessionCredentials from PasswordAuthenticator. 

could you please help me to see what I did wrong? 

Thanks a lot,
William

title: i got it now, please close
Character counter on dev reply
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
implement the XXX of 350 characters counter like the dev console shows.

This gives people the opportunity to c&p text and shortened it.

OK button will only be enabled when the chat count it >0 and <=350

title: Andlytics not updating data from the Developer Console
body:
Since yesterday about 7pm CET, the app stopped fetching any new data from the Console (reviews, ratings, etc.). It did work for a few hours after the daily downloads data was imported.

AdMob data is shown fine on the AdMob tab, but it is not shown in the main "Dashboard" view when the view is refreshed.

title: Authentication Failed Notification :: Even when the app works fine
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="need more info")]
body:
After https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues/355 was fixed, the app seems to be working fine but every time i open the app, I get an authentication failed notification, clicking on which the developer console opens in browser. 

Also, the refresh is extremely slow, even on WIFI. Takes about 4 to 5 minutes to load the incremental data. Sometimes the spinner goes on and one and there is nothing till i reopen the app. Works fine when opening again after such endless spinning.

title: handle single escape as well, see #424
Comments' number does not increment past 4500
body:
Hi,

I've commented on Google Play about this issue and was asked to open a thread here. I'll quote my text from there:

"(...) I still have a 'bug report' to do: I have apps with more than 4500 comments, but for some reason, Andlytics stopped counting them when it got to 4500. Can you fix that?"

The app I'm referring to is http://goo.gl/CiY6s. Weirdly, since the counter got to 4500 comments, it stopped incrementing, even though I was still receiving (and answering) new comments via Andlytics.

title: Better developer name and comment reply error handling, see #424
Authentication failed
body:
Since the last update (2.5.0), I always get Authentication failed errors when it tries to sync.

There is a Toast coming up saying "Authentication failed for tomas.skare@gmail.com".

There is also a notification saying "Additional authentication required. Tap to login via browser".

I tap it, and it goes directly to my developer console in the browser, without any need to enter any password or other type of authentication.

But Andlytics always fails to login anyway. I've also tried to delete all data for Andlytics to start over, but it gives the same thing.

I have two accounts on the phone, if that matters. Only one of them have apps published, and that's the one I'm selecting. 

It has worked fine up until the recent 2.5.0 release.

title: Translation Updates for NL and TR
AdMob not working, gives account missing error
body: Admob does not work with most accounts, as all accounts are now linked to Google. The error states that linked accounts are blocked by Google, and they are developing an OATH method. Using POST with the v2 API and the individual client_key value works. The application does not appear to support this process.

title: Problem with admob / SD card
body:
This came in via email, but I do not use admob, can anyone of you reproduce this?

Reproducing:
1) have the andlytics installed in the phone memory
2) add an admob account
3) move the app to the sdcard
4) open andlytics and it will say "account xxx is missing. If this happens repeatedly try moving Andlytics from SD card to internal storage"
5) move the app back to internal storage
6) open andlytics again and face the same message.

Tested on:
Samsung Nexus S
Android 4.2
Cyanogenmod 10.1 Nightly 18/04/2013

Any ideas @nelenkov @willlunniss ?

title: Improvements for editing of comment replies
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I just realized that you can edit the developer reply on the console. If you click on the dev reply in Andlytics you can edit the text. Pressing Ok and thus sending it leads to a network error. 

So I guess the call for editing an existing comment is another one.

title: Skip Account (on multi-linked accounts) when it doesn't have any apps
body:
I came across the following behavior.

Setting:
a multi-linked account which has two links: one with one app and one with no apps at all.
The one with no apps is the first one (alphabetical ordering).

Using this multi-linked account I just get a toast basically telling me found no apps so it looks to me like we stop looking for apps if the first account doesn't have any instead of skipping and checking the next account.

Unfortunately I am not very familiar with these parts of the code base so I would need some hints or maybe you guys could have a look at the code @nelenkov @willlunniss

title: check for null (ContentValues.put() doesn't handle null)
body: May get nulls when importing data from older versions. See #392

title: AppInfo page: Fix error creating numerous app info rows, preventing changelog/descript...
body: ...ions from being updated.

title: parse and save whitelisted features; don't show comment reply button if ...
body: ...not available. See #363

title: Should we remove references to the old translation system
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: I.e. remove the long click action, and remove the associated preferences now that the comments are already translated.

title: Fixed typos in the changelog
body: Just fixed typo Goolge -> Google

title: move translations to crowdin.net
label: [Label(name="docs & advertising"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Reminder for me to move over to crowdin after 2.5.0 since the translation engine is better than on gl.

Project has already been created and has been approved as an OSS project by crowdin

http://crowdin.net/project/andlytics

title: FR: Support BugSense API
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="future")]
body:
I didn't know they had an API (maybe it's new?), but it should be relatively easy to support. 
Should be more useful than the dev console errors. 

http://www.bugsense.com/docs/api/read

title: Importing exported data skipping erroneous data sets
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This came in via email. 

Problem seems to be that the export had some erroneous / incomplete data sets which somehow blocked the import after cleaning up the export he could import the file.

So one thing would be imho to skip lines that are incomplete or erroneous in any way and we might have to look into the export to check if the code can skip exporting data that leads to problems during the import.

I can email the zip file whenever someone starts on this issue ( @nelenkov @willlunniss or me)

title: comment reply tweaks
body: changed reply icon to standard icon

title: Problem with special characters in passwords
body:
I seems that there is a problem with passwords with special characters, such as # and \* in the app with the connection to AdMob,because i have those special characters in my admob password and i can login in via admob website, but cannot connect via andlytics.

 I changed my password and now it does not have any special characters and the connection of andlytics and admob works perfect, so there is a problem with that.

title: simplified comment layout and constrained device name length
Authentication failed
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Ever since 1 April 2013, I've been getting "authentication failed" errors and have not been able to synch.  This is both on my phone and on my tablet.

Have Google changed their API again?  I recall this was a problem before Christmas.  Is anyone else having this problem?

Many thanks for your work on this app.

Andrew

title: reply to comments and toggle translations
body: see #363

title: revert back to check boxes, SwithcPerferences takes up too much space
icon and language formatting, see discussion pull #372
body: see discussion pull #372

title: Redesign slightly
body:
- moved Add back to action bar
- added app icon
- moved Play Store button to app info section

title: slightly less ugly language display
body: someone please test if/how this works with replies

title: persist comment language and original text
body: Still needs a proper UI and maybe a toggle setting

title: quick hack to display translated comments
body:
Needs more work: 
- persist comment language
- decide whether to persist original comment or translated text (right now translation)
- detect locale changes and invalidate comment cache (see above, right now you get cached values which may be different from the current locale; need to refresh manually)
- better UI
- maybe add an option to display original comment

title: more debug logging for AppInfo parsing
Authentication failed
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body: The application can't update my stats because of an authentication problem.

title: first pass at support for large number of apps (two step info fetching), cf. #361
open browser if we don't get a MergeSession URL from AccountManager
Reply to users comments via the app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Just got developer replies enabled on my account, busy right now but will look at it over the weekend if possible.

POST to

```
https://play.google.com/apps/publish/v2/reviews?dev_acc=DEV_ACC_ID
```

Payload

```
{"method":"sendReply","params":{"1":"PACKAGE_NAME","2":"COMMENT_ID","3":"REPLY"},"xsrf":"XSRF_TOKEN"}
```

Result

```
{"result":{"1":{"1":"REPLY","3":"TIME_STAMP"},"2":true},"xsrf":"XSRF_TOKEN"}
```

title: Redesign notifications
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Users with many apps on their account do have slight problems reading the notification due to the mass of apps, see screenshot:
![Screenshot_2013-03-09-15-07-05](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1315170/248566/02787324-8b15-11e2-855d-56d2a959bb64.png)

Besides reformatting the notification (this came in via email):
We could also add a notification area so people could check the notifications on a separate tab (from the main screen or via an menu item).
This would definitely need some thinking and changes to the app (new Activity, screen design etc.)

Not sure though if it is possible to reformat the notifications a bit nicer...

@schoentoon any ideas?

title: No published apps found
label: [Label(name="need more info")]
body:
Hello, 

I love this app, it is so usefull. Unfortunately after a few days all of a sudden it stopped working, Everytime I tried to update it gave me the "no published apps found" message. 

Tried unsitalling, and reinstalling, tried deleting and re-syncing the gmail account. Tried using a different phone, etc and no avail. Nightly build or the latest uptade released to the Google Play Store did not help either.

I'm at a loss, I really wanted this app to work since its fantastic for keeping track of my app's ratings and downloadand there is nothing like it.

I also get sometimes the "authentication failed" error but if I click the re-sync icon, it syncs OK again,only that it still doesn't find my apps anymore.

Regards,
Carlos.

The comments simply don't load. This bug started today, yesterday was functioning normally.

title: Error and blank Screen :: No Published apps found :: since December 12
body:
Dear Andlytics Team,

First of all :: Great App!

But, I miss the inferences i could derive from Andlytics before it stopped working for me. I thought I should let you know about the same as there is a probability many others might be experiencing the same issue.

Error message i get: "No published App Found"

Following is the information which may help analysing the issue:
I have about 78 Apps published on play store and spans across two pages on the developer console. Two of them are in suspended state and one unpublished.

My device: Samsung Galaxy S Plus (i9001)
Android Version: 2.3 Gingerbread

Andlytics version installed: 2.4.2

It would be great if could learn about a fix for this OR if you could fix the API and make me happy again. :-)

Again, Great App ... love it but, miss it. :-(

title: GH #352 redesigned links page
body:
OK, I think I've got this all done now. I tried to make the UI consistent with the existing Andlytics UI, but I couldn't find examples of "labeled" text. All of the Andlytics pages show content with obvious context ("N comments, Y downloads", etc).

The whole page scrolls now, too. The original layout I had set up totally failed in landscape mode.

![device-2013-02-28-164120](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/165134/207982/342eeea8-8209-11e2-8898-64916a6e2942.png)

title: Add AppInfo page with description, etc. and custom links
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
See #348 for initial discussion.

App description, changelog and last update date are now available in `AppDetails`. `Links` is linked to `AppDetails` by FK. `AppDetails` are linked to `AppInfo` by FK, but are lazily fetched. Call `AndlyticsDb.fetchAppDetails()` to fetch when needed. See `AndlyticsDb` for other related methods. 

Other ideas from #348:

> One thing I want to see via the app is which version is currently live, that would fit perfectly in this sort of screen. I would also say simply always have a link to the app on google play at the top, its so common that there is no need to let the user choose if they want it.

title: Added AppDetails table/class; linked Links to AppDetails with FK
added more debug logging for skipped apps
added more debug logging for skipped apps
new feature: links associated with apps.
body:
I was looking for a way to link from Andlytics to the Google Play store so I could monitor things not tracked in the app -- like the "more by" and "also viewed" links, the G+1 counter, etc.

Then I realized that I look at a lot more than just the Play store: Amazon's web store stats, Flurry stats, Google+/Facebook pages dedicated to the app, and so on.

So, I added a new "links" feature for Andlytics. This feature allows you to add arbitrary URLs to list of links associated with an app. You can reach the links page by tapping the app's icon on the main screen.

This is my first contribution to Andlytics; please let me know if I should have handled this differently.

title: Line Charts Seem off by 12 hours (Visual Bug)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Not sure on the etiquette on just tweaking things I think are off. To me it seems rude to just make a pull request without first discussing it.

In my opinion the Line Charts seems off by 12 hours.
when creating the values for the chart the date is being set at midday causing the plot to be put right in the middle of the day. I feel that the plot should line up with the line the date is labelled on.

To give you an idea. This is how it currently looks (Taken on my phone using Play Store Version, so the data/scale of both screenshots are different)
![old](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1392296/139253/9453b448-71e8-11e2-87a1-a2913b278fc5.png)
And this is how I think it should look (Taken on my tablet using the dev branch with a little tweak)
![new](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1392296/139270/801b2640-71e9-11e2-91db-14416839cbf6.png)
To me it just feels better.
What I did to fix it was in `/chart/Chart.java` I changed a few things in the statsForApp for loop in buildLineChart(). First I changed the date to a Calender because the method setHours(0) from the type Date is deprecated and then used `calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0);` to tweak the date to midnight making the plot land on the line the date is lined up to.

I've made the quick change to my fork of dev for buildLineChart() only because I think the Bar Charts for ratings and downloads seem to look all right with the date in the middle of the bar.
You can see my change here. https://github.com/CrosseyeJack/andlytics/commit/9c9f26269f633bbe4c4301c8d06fc302f9fc70c0 (EDIT: Does help if I post a link to the change :-p) If you think its a good idea then I'll give it a bit more of a test and make sure it ok code then make a pull request. It was a quick code change during a coffee break (tbh I spent more time writing this and snapping the screenshots then making the change :-p) so I've not testing the code properly.

title: Added "Month to Date" Time Frame Option
body:
Modified strings.xml to add "Month to Date" String (No translations sorry)
Modified charts_menu.xml files to Add "Month to Date" Option
Modified Prefernces.java to add "MONTH_TO_DATE" to Timeframe enum
Modified BaseChartActivity.java to include "MONTH_TO_DATE" in onCreateOptionsMenu() and onOptionsItemSelected(). Copied the functionality of the other options.
Modified ContentAdapter.java to include "MONTH_TO_DATE" to getAdmobStats() and getStatsForApp(). Using Calendar.getInstance().get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH); to grab the day of the month to set again the limit.

Finally getting my head around GitHub, This pull request is much clearer and cleaner. Sorry for the mess up with the last one.

First I'm new to github (Yeah I know :-p) so still finding my feet like where the add label buttons are :-p

title: FR: Google Wallet integration
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
TaRSyS asked me if we would like to integrate Google Checkout in our app.

He gave me the implementation of his app which he will then discontinue:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=tarsys.mycheckout

If you are fine with this feature @nelenkov and @willlunniss I will open a new feature branch and start working on this in the upcoming weeks/month (no idea yet how long this will take :)

I already checked with him and he is fine with publishing his implementation (as part of Andlytics) under the Apache License.

title: Wrong App shown
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="need more info")]
body:
Loving the App! Keep it up. I have 2 different Play Store Accounts which both have Apps released.

Account 1: 4 released Apps, 3 unreleased Apps
Account 2: 1 releaded App, 1 unreleased App

Both Accounts are connected (The Accounts can look into the other one's statistics...) to each other.

Everything is shown correctly except Account 2 is showing the unreleased App instead of the released one. Looks like it doesn't recognize another App there.

title: Fetching data with PHP
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
Hi!

I've been really impressed by your app so far, and what it's able to do, and I thought that maybe you could give me some piece of advice.
If you can't, that's okay :)

I've been looking for a solution all over the internet, and you are quite my last hope to achieve this project.

I'm currently developping, for private use, a website which would allow my friends (or other people) to watch the statistics of the mobile applications which I developped, statistics which would be fetched from Itunes Connect, and Google Developper Console.

So far, I've managed to do interesting things for the Itunes part of the work (fetching data, getting it into a database... basic stuff you would say) because there are scripts and API existing, that I can tweak to fit my needs. But I can't figure how to gain access to the Developer Console's data.

Right now, I'm looking for guidelines so I could figure out how to get data from the Google Developer console, which seems quite not friendly for this special use.

I already tried to send POST requests (based on what I sniffed looking at the console) after authenticating in PHP via Oauth 2 process. I couldn't test my authentication because I didn't know what requests I should use. And since there isn't any API to allow me to communicate with Google for this developer console, I'm stuck.

I've read your information/TODO page about it, but it seems like the login part is still on the high level to do list... :( 

I don't know if you've made recent progress about all this stuff, but I'd be glad to have any further information, since you look quite documented on the subject.

Keep up the good work! :D

title: About Screen implementation
body:
see #265

recycled the feedback menu item which is now opening the about list where the user can choose between three options:
- about/credits (has github and social media sites and lists all the used libraries/licenses(
- changelog (so the user can reopen it at any time)
- feedback

title: added ABS as submodule
body:
Removed included ABS sources and added as a submodule. 

This makes it easy to pull fixes directly from ABS, but also has some issues: 
- cloning the project is now a bit harder: you have to remember to `git submodule init` and `git submodule update` to actually get all the code
- the submodule is just a pointer to the remote commit, so if you update, you need to remember to push in order to update the pointer. This makes sure everyone is using the same ABS code.
- we can't really push changes to ABS remotely (like `lint.xml`, etc.), only make local changes (or I just haven't figured out how to do it properly)

More info: http://git-scm.com/book/en/Git-Tools-Submodules

Not merging this for now, so people can comment/review.

title: Extract the scraper for general purposes
body: It would be nice if someone can eliminate the dependence from the android sdk so scraper can be used as standalone lib.

title: No published apps found
body:
I have around 30 apps but I still this a message saying "no published apps found"  followed by the error reporting dialogue.

This problem never used to happen until recent interface change.  It looked like it got fixed in 2.3.1 but it's happening again. 

I do have some unpublished apps and 1 draft app if that helps. 

Thanks

title: Feature request
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I will make some remarks:

(I have the Galaxy Note)
1. The new font size in the tables is much to large so that a cell exceed one line

100
%                       for exampel

The same for the Buttons - the German text needs 2 lines

Bewertunge
n

My opinion is that the text for buttons is not need anymore. The images are meaningfull enough and you get more screen space.
1.  The larger font in the chart is good.
2. A very usefull chart would be  installations per day. This is the important value and not the downloads for me. 
   Whats the currect success of new version of my app?
3. The  Install/Download ratio is important to.  
   But the chart shows an endless cummulation value. So you cannot judge the current state.
   The ratio of this values with a moving average over custom days would be nice. (Simple calculation)
   
    If you want to integrate it, ask me how to handle the    x / 0   values.
   
   I am Physicis a have some more idea for statistical analysis.
4. Advertising view -    a precision of 2 digits for fill rate is really not need     100.00   newline % you get on the Note
5. Advertising view - The ratio  Clicks / Impressions would be nice.
6. The 3 Monthchart is good. Maybe further time ranges   6 Month - or more simple a custom value 1 - 100 weeks
7. The moving of the time interval in the chart with the fingers would be nice.  
   Additional Zoom ?

weichert@internet-port.de

title: Restart app after home button - bug
body:
Try to close the app from its main screen with the Home-Button. Restart the app (task-manager or icon click) and click refresh. 
App shows  ALLWAYS a error dialog.

Close with back-button works. This seem to be the only way to work with it.

title: write JSON responses we cannot parse to disk for debugging
Error deleting AdMob account
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hello:

I wanted to delete the AdMob information for one app so I can re-add the account (when restoring my apps with Titanium Backup, I get the error that says that AdMob login info has been lost, and doing this fixes it). However, when I click on the "Remove AdMob" menu option, Andlytics crashes.

I have tried this with a clean install and the same happens once I add an AdMob account, then try to remove it.

The report gets sent via ACRA, but I thought it would be nice to add some more info by creating an issue.

Here's the stacktrace:


title: "Error while requesting developer console" in version 2.3
body:
Hello:

I updated to the latest Andlytics version and the typical error pop-up shows up. I have seen on logcat that the following error is thrown:

```
12-18 10:06:45.315: E/Main(18865): Error while requesting developer console : {"result":[null,[[null,[null,"cat.ereza.apm",[null,[[null,"en-US","APM?","Aquesta aplicació conté més de 650 sons de frases de l'APM? perquè les puguis reproduir en qualsevol moment, sense necessitat de tenir connexió!

A part de reproduir-les, també podràs fer tot això:
-Definir un conjunt de frases preferides per accedir-hi més ràpidament.
-Definir-les com a to de notificació, telèfon, alarma o contacte.
-Enviar-les per WhatsApp, correu o MMS.
-Crear converses combinant diversos sons i compartir-los o reproduir-los com un de sol.
-Afegir frases com a widgets a l'escriptori.
-Veure els vídeos de YouTube de cada so! (necessitaràs connexió a Internet)
-Enviar-les com a enllaç a Facebook, Twitter, etc.
-Reproduir sons aleatòriament
-Utilitzar el mode de broma perquè soni una frase quan moguis el mòbil!

ATENCIÓ! Els widgets només funcionaran si l'aplicació està instal·lada a la memòria interna! Si la passes a la SD, no podràs afegir-ne i els existents poden mostrar errors o desaparèixer (no és culpa nostra, Android funciona així).

APM? (Alguna Pregunta Més?) és un programa de televisió que s'emet a Televisió de Catalunya (TV3). Aquesta aplicació no ha estat desenvolupada per TV3 i per tant NO és oficial.

Explicació dels permisos:
-Modificar contingut de la SD/emmagatzematge USB: per poder passar-la a la SD o emmagatzematge USB i escriure fitxers temporals en compartir els sons
-Accés total a Internet i visualitzar l'estat de la xarxa: anuncis AdMob i estadístiques anònimes
-Llegir i escriure dades de contactes: per assignar tons a contactes concrets
-Modificar la configuració del sistema: per definir tons de trucada

Nota de versions:
-Els usuaris amb Android 2.2 o superior tenen accés a l'última versió.
-Els usuaris amb Android 2.1 tenen accés a la versió 3.2.2.1 (22/06/2012), les versions posteriors no són compatibles.
-Els usuaris amb Android inferior a 2.1 tenen accés a la versió 2.2.4 (17/02/2012), les versions posteriors no són compatibles.

---

This application contains more than 650 sounds of phrases from APM? so you can listen to them at any time, without a data connection!

Apart from playing them, you can also do the following:
-Define a set of phrases as favorites, so you can access them quickly.
-Define them as notificacion, phone, alarm or contact tones.
-Send them through WhatsApp, e-mail or MMS.
-Create conversations by combining different sounds and share or play them as a unique sound.
-Add phrases as widgets on the desktop.
-Watch the YouTube video of every sound! (you'll need an Internet connection)
-Send them as links to Facebook, Twitter, etc.
-Play random sounds
-Use the Prank Mode to play a phrase when you move your device!

WARNING! Widgets will only work if the application is installed on the internal memory! If you install it on the SD card, you will not be able to add any widget, and the existing ones may show errors or disappear (it's not our fault, Android works this way).

APM? (Alguna Pregunta Més?) is a television program broadcasted by Televisió de Catalunya (TV3). This application has not been developed by TV3 and as such, it is NOT official.

Permissions explanation:
-Modify SD/USB storage contents: to be able to copy it to the SD card or USB storage and write temporary files when sharing sounds
-Total Internet access and view network state: AdMob ads and anonymous statistics
-Read and write contacts data: to be able to set ringtones for specific contacts
-Modify system settings: to be able to set ringtones

Versions note:
-Users with Android 2.2 or newer have access to the latest version.
-Users with Android 2.1 have access to version 3.2.2.1 (22/06/2012), newer versions are not compatible.
-Users with Android below 2.1 have access to version 2.2.4 (17/02/2012), newer versions are not compatible.","","Versió 3.4.2.1:
-Afegits 8 sons nous!
-Corregit l'enllaç al vídeo del so "Cabró" (gràcies, Oriol!)
-
```

Could it be related to the fact that most of my apps use multiple APKs and are not yet supported by the new Developer Console? However, all the info that Andlytics shows is still visible and usable in v2 (comments, ratings and downloads), it's just that I can't edit the listing.

Maybe I'm wrong and it has to do with encoding, or any other thing?

I can send you more details if you tell me how to do it.

My device info in case this matters: Samsung GT-I9300 with Android 4.2 (CyanogenMod 10.1 nightly)

Its been a busy few months but 2.3 is now pretty much ready to go. I've just prepared a new beta however, I've just seen that the download section has been removed, any suggestions? Upload it somewhere else or just skip the beta and go with the release?

Hi!
I installed this amazing app on my phone (Galaxy SII) but I noticed a very annoying issue. This app drain a lot of battery, 16% over 1 cycle.

title: added num errors to import/export; properly fetch in ContentAdapter

Manage Andlytics developer accounts using the app DB
Move multi-valued preferences to the DB
body:
Move per-account, per-package, etc. preferences to the DB. Migrate existing preferences when upgrading the DB (on first run of the 2.3)

Currently this includes: 
- account-related stuff => `developer_account` table / `DeveloperAccount` class
  - account name
  - state (hidden, selected, etc.)
  - last stats update time
- AdMob related stuff => added columns to the `appinfo` table
  - account name
  - site ID 
- comments related stuff => added column to the `appinfo` table
  - last comments update

Anything else that might be better off in the DB?

body:
- comments refresh timestamp
- AdMob account and site ID

title: migrated account, AdMob and comment update settings to the DB
body: WIP: nothing uses the DB values yet.

title: show commets w/ null user as by 'A Google user' to match dev console
body: Seems the rumoured transition to commenting via G+ is under way? All comments are now shown as by "A Google User" in the dev console. Matching that, further changes might be needed as/if this develops.

cleaned up permissions

- comments are only refreshed if at least 5 mins have passed since last refresh

properly detach taks; made ChartActivity AsyncTask static

moved autosync initialization to LoginActivity

title: Autosync Admob stats
body: Currently the automatic synchronization only fetches dev console stats. Admob has its own account/authenticator, so this shouldn't be too hard to do. Just add a new `AdmobSyncService`?

title: introduced DevConsoleV2Protocol
body: Extracted protocol details (URLs, post data, result parsing) in separate class. DevConsoleV2 now only coordinates authentication and data fetching.

title: Exception handling and V2 console cleanup
body:
- made console exceptions REs
- cleaner exception handling
- some refactoring

title: Revise Google Play Listing
label: [Label(name="docs & advertising")]
body:
I just tried typing in a few things that someone who wants Andlytics, but don't know its name might type, e.g. 'developer console', 'developer tools' etc.. Andlytics was pretty far down the list with a lot of unreleated junk in between in some cases. I think we could re-wite the listing to help users discover Andlytics.

1) Remove the part about being the official release, its been long enough. @8p8web could you unpublish your version please.

2) Reword the rest to mention certain keywords (I'm not that great at this sort of thing but maybe something like this)

> Andlytics collects statistics from the Google Play Developer Console. It lets you track active installs, total installs, ratings, and comments for all your Android apps that are published on Google Play.
> 
> Andlytics can also collect AdMob statistics, including revenue, requests and impressions. It supports background syncing of stats and notifications for when changes occur.
> 
> Google does not provide a public API for collecting statistics. Therefore, if Google makes a change to the site it may cause Andlytics to stop working. In that case please be patient while we try to catch up.
> 
> Andlytics is open source, please feel free to contribute via GitHub.
> 
> Andlytics is not associated with Google in any way.
> 
> "Google Apps for Business"  and Multi-connected developer accounts are not supported yet. If you have one of these accounts, contact us via GitHub and help us to add support.
> 
> On some devices AdMob accounts keep disappearing, moving Andlytics from sdcard to internal storage might fix this.
> 
> For AdMob accounts that are linked to a Google Account you can find the API password on the Account Information page http://www.admob.com/my_account/account_info.
> 
> Keywords: Developer console, developer tools, android developers

title: Fixed wrong sync period. Don't use separate processes.
properly handle auth failure in silent mode
body:
don't try to sync hidden accounts, since this will result in auth failure

Needs more testing, including 2FA, but for some reason it won't send the verification SMS to my phone...

title: Mostly working token authenticator
body: Not particularly robust and does work in the sync adapter, but should work otherwise.

title: Package restructuring
body: moved console realted classes to console.v1/v2 package, removed exception pacakge

title: keep a per account registry of console clients
body: Tentative, but something like this should work.

title: Made DevConsoleV2 a singleton
body: Use a shared HttpClient instance, clean up posting and fetch comments using the V2 class.

title: authenticate and parse app info and stats from v2 console
body: This saves and adds all cookies, only AD is not sufficient. Still doesn't use the active install count from the app info result.

title: Removed demo leftovers and 'comments_author' (by) from resources
removed 'by' in comments view; added reply date
Update ActionBarSherlock
body:
The dev branch has a _lot_ of fixes and ABS 4.2 is due this or next week. Build new version with it. 

Related: why do we bundle (an outdated version of) ABS in the Andlytics project again?

title: quick hack to show comment replies
body: Still not cached in DB, but should allow for testing.

title: Parse and store comment replies
body: adds a 'Comment reply' field to Comment. Need to display this and save in DB.

title: Display and store developer replies to comments
body:
Replies are now fetched, still need to store them in the db
# 

My account has been upgraded to use the "reply to comment" feature, and since then new comments are not collected. Andlytics detects change in the number of comments, but the comment page is not refreshing and stays with the last comment before I was upgraded.
I can make myself available for tests if necessary.

title: Database error updating appinfo
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:

title: Font size of the charts on tablets too small
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Came in via mail:

---

Hello !

The Andlytics is really a great and very usefull program. I like it.
One think I dont like.
The fon in the chart is so so so so so so so so small on my Galaxy Note so that I can not see it.
Please enlarge it! Maybe px to dp for densitiy indementdent scaling

By
Andreas 

---

title: Dateformat option for display
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Came in via email:

---

First off, this is a great app! Thank you for creating it!

I have a small request, could you add a US dateformat option for the displays?

Thanks,
Alex

---

Makes sense imho, question is how to implement this. Thus I would like to discuss possible implementations first. We could add a general preference for this where users could choose from a list of format patterns.
Best thing would be if this could be done automatically based on the language set. But I do not know if these patterns are somehow connected to the language in general, so I don't know if it is possible to ask Android for the "right" pattern...

Any ideas input?

title: Updated parser for new data format
API Changed (30/08/12)
body:
The API has changed again, i've got the new codes for the post data (I think its just these that have changed). 
Here are the new strings:

``` java
private static final String GET_ASSET_INDEX_FOR_USER = "7|2|7|https://play.google.com/apps/publish/gwt/|2BCF4D167ACB0F4BCB3EBA75DDAA0575|com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.XsrfToken/4254043109|"
            + PARAM_XSRFTOKEN + "|com.google.wireless.android.vending.developer.shared.AppEditorService|getAssetIndexForUser|I|1|2|3|4|5|6|1|7|100|";

private static final String GET_FULL_ASSET_INFO_FOR_USER_REQUEST = "7|2|9|https://play.google.com/apps/publish/gwt/|2BCF4D167ACB0F4BCB3EBA75DDAA0575|com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.XsrfToken/4254043109|"
            + PARAM_XSRFTOKEN
            + "|com.google.wireless.android.vending.developer.shared.AppEditorService|getProductInfosForUser|java.lang.String/2004016611|I|"
            + PARAM_APPNAME + "|1|2|3|4|5|6|4|7|8|8|7|9|0|" + PARAM_LENGTH + "|0|";
```

However, it is failing inside `GwtParser:getAppInfos` when trying to read the icon url. By the looks of it things have been moved around/shifted, unfortunately without a copy of what it used to look like, its hard to follow all of the logic. Put a breakpoint at line 565 to get to the problem part.

So for my first app getIndexStringValue(iconIndex) is called with 4509 which internally gets 7 from the indexList where instead it should now be 12. But I don't understand enough about how indexList is built. Looking at the raw json it is quite confusing, as not all of my apps follow the same pattern. And because each bit of info is based on the previous ones index, its all out. Updating the icon one doesn't really help though, as the version code is not where it is expected etc...

title: Refactored some string resources for comments
body: Refactored according to [this discussion](https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/commit/8bff3c548d8beb9dba5283b75ad59d7cb2542abf#-P0)

title: Moved some colors and strings to resources. Fixed typos.
body: Removed old dead code.

title: removed rating images in favor of rating bar / refined arrow icons
body: some housekeeping, minor icon changes...

title: Fresh install shows confusing startupscreen
body:
I have 2 android developer accounts on my phone. Had installed a self-built version a while ago.
So I deleted it, and installed the new version from market (2.2.2, from aug 17).

First time running, I am presented with a list of the 2 accounts, with checkboxes to their rights. Apart from a + (plus) at the 
top-right (to set up a new account), no other actions are available to me.

Turns out, I can just click one of the 2 rows, to continue. Clicking one of the 2 rows, will present me with both accounts in the actionbar anyway.

My question becomes, why the checkboxes? Why this startup screen at all?

title: Some Toast strings moved to resources. Typos fixed.
body: Moved some strings to resources for further translation. Also moved some hard-coded strings to private-strings.xml

title: Twitter account for the app
label: [Label(name="docs & advertising")]
body: I was thinking that [this account](https://twitter.com/andlytics) will be updated regularly, tweeting about new releases and other stuff. But it looks abandoned, no new posts and it has a link to an outdated clone. Do we have an access to it? Who is the owner? If it cant be owned by Andlytics project, I suppose we should create a new one and use it extensively.

title: Show an overview of ratings using colour coded progress bars
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: At the moment we show a number next to each different number of stars, this is not very helpful for conveying the distribution of ratings. I would like to change it to match what you see on Google Play and on the new Developer Console. Any objections?

title: Explizitly handle connection problems
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
To get a cleaner error reporting we should start handling connection problems like the following two. In these cases we should just show a toast saying something like "Can't reach developer console, please try again later".

This is mainly for stability reasons since this spams the error reporting (and this is not a software bug) + plus we could show the user some information so he or she knows about the connections problem.
