title: Add an option to disable auto-refresh in onResume
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This came in via comments on Google Play

Please add an option to disable auto-refresh every time the app becomes visible. This is very annoying on slow connections.

This could be done quite easily with another general option so we do not auto-refresh and only refresh based on the refresh rate that has been configured. This also happens when you switch accounts via action bar.

title: Ordering of the menu items on the bottom bar
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This came in via comments on Google Play:

Nina - August 12, 2012 - Version 2.2.0
Pu update button to the edge of the screen
Is is not obvious to do this? You think people import export stats so many times that you put the only necessary reffesh button so far from hands? Iam just bored of such a stupdness. Please fix!!!!

She has a point in my opinion. Refresh and +/-/% should be on the right side. 

Is this possible looking at landscape vs. portrait mode?

Any opinions on the ordering in general?

title: NPE on performing sync
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
bundle seems to be NULL in case something went wrong with the authentication:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.github.andlyticsproject.sync.SyncAdapterService.performSync(SyncAdapterService.java:89)
at com.github.andlyticsproject.sync.SyncAdapterService.access$0(SyncAdapterService.java:79)
at com.github.andlyticsproject.sync.SyncAdapterService$SyncAdapterImpl.onPerformSync(SyncAdapterService.java:58)
at android.content.AbstractThreadedSyncAdapter$SyncThread.run(AbstractThreadedSyncAdapter.java:163) 

BugSense Error #49254103
Occurences so far: 5

We could ether catch the NPE or put in an NULL check before we call a method on the bundle

title: Release 2.2.1
body:
Any other issues that need to be fixed before 2.3 that we should put into 2.2.1?

So far I think it is just #174 which is now fixed in dev. (Changelog note would be something like: Fixed loosing the scroll position when navigating back to the main app list)

title: Comments are duplicated after navigating back from a translation
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Another bug reported in the comments, it was an existing issue so not something we introduced.

title: Pressing back from BaseDetailsActivity to Main resets the scroll position in Main
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Reported via comments.

I through it was always like this, but aparently not. What is the nicest solution that we can implement so that when you click on the details for app number 5, view the details, then press back, the scroll position is maintained and you are still at app number 5?

For now a hack would be to send the packageName in the intent to main, and then in main, if packageName != null, scroll to packageName.

A better solution would be to possibly use onIntentRecieved for switching accounts.

title: FR: Mobfox support
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="future")]
body:
Support for other ad-networks:
http://mobfox.com/

title: Merge Dev to Master (v2.2.0)
body: Merging back development branch (release 2.2.0)

title: Started filling in the data for v2 of the developer console.
body: Nothing works at the moment, see code for TODOs FIXMEs and general comments

title: updated ACRA, enabled BugSense
body:
- updated ACRA version
- added BugSense reporter
- added toggle ACRA preference 
- only init ACRA on release builds

title: Line ending normalising
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: This is one for the git experts, in svn you usually set a property on the repo that automatically does this for all source files. I recently tried github for windows to quickly make a few changes on my laptop and it wanted to enable this feature (either enabling it, or dissabling it made it want to update a number of files). Question is, is it worth it? https://help.github.com/articles/dealing-with-line-endings

title: added confirmation dialogs for import/export
body: properly save selection state

title: Removed some unused layouts, renamed layouts, fixed some more warnings and updated the alternative menu to match the corresponding layout
added margins for tablet land and moved chart landscape layout.
body:
to w600dp-land

(this should really be in a different branch...)

title: Show side by side chart and table in landscape mode if there is enough space.
body:
This can be improved on later by switching between the chart and table for devices that do not have enough space.

It also finishes off hiding settings button for AdMob if needed, and fixes the progress spinner when rotating in the Import/Export activities.

title: Lint warnings
body:
Fixed some lint warnings, replaced Map<Integer, T> with SparseArray<T> (no boxing->faster)

There are still some duplicated icons warnings, can someone review those?

title: Release 2.2
body:
I think we are pretty much ready for 2.2. But before that, I think it would be wise if everybody synced their forks with the dev branch (especially as a lot of the code has been mass formatted) and then tested all the awsome new changes for at least a day. But otherwise we should be ready for releasing 2.2.

Some point that we need to convey to users:
*Preferences have to be re-configured (some remain the same, but it is best to say you have to do all of them)
*New zipped import/export requires extra steps to import old versions

I guess the import/export change should be in the description for the next month or so. Preferences should be fine to just have a note in the change log.

> Changelog:
> *New account management
> *Split preferences into general and account specific (you will need to re-configure all your prefrences)
> *Improved notification options and new JB notifications
> *New zip based import/export to make it easier to share stats between devices
> *Added a toggle to hide AdMob for unconfigured apps
> *Lots of smaller UI changes and general improvements

Once we are happy we can then in the dev branch:
*Bump the version
*Add the changelog

Then merge into the master branch and tag it.

title: Preference changes for new notification options
Fixed FC when trying to read the auto sync value due to ListPreference storing it as a String. Fixed some warnings.
Settings menu item "not working" on landscape for ratings/downloads
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The settings button doesn't do anything being in landscape mode...

So we should hide it or swap the graphs with the preferences like we do it with the data part of the view in portrait mode.

title: Zipped export -- fixed final notifications and .csv extensions
body:
- don't show .csv extension in import dialog
- final notifications are not outgoing any more

title: Zipped export -- detach AsyncTasksand use NotificationCompat
body:
Properly handle orientation changes by detaching AsyncTasks. Use new style notifications if available. 

See util/DetachableAsyncTask and use/improve as necessary for other AsyncTasks.

title: Code cleanup
body:
We were never going to agree on this and I know some of you won't like this, but I've tried to make all the code match the majority of the code which I think is fair enough. I mass formatted the code, and then did partial reviews of it. If you find more lines that look silly being split in two, then do change them.

README.md now says the following:

> When submitting code, please try to be consistent with the code around you. As a general rule:
> 1. Use Tabs, not spaces
> 2. Aim for a maximum line length of 100, unless it looks better being on a single line

title: Fixed getting 'No published apps found' toasts due to accountName being ...
body: ...set to null while an async task that was previously started was still running. TODO: Must fix the async tasks

title: Add support for JellyBean notifications
body: It uses the NotificationCompat2. I will show the app icon in the LargeIcon, if the notification is for multiple app it'll show the icon of the first app. And if you expand the notification on JB it'll show all the content info. I originally tried to implement a way to view the rating changes, I even got this to work, but I couldn't get it to work properly. I find the code around creating custom styles in API 16 kinda broken and even more broken in NotificationCompat2. Which is kinda sad. But this is as good as it get's at this point of time.

title: Adjustments for the 'Refresh' action item and it's action mode (closes #141)
Added a toggle to hide the AdMob tab for unconfigured apps (closes #149)
Tablet UI
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Any suggestions for small changes that could improve things? Or is this going to have to wait until we get some of the code moved into Fragments?

title: JellyBean notifications and notifications in general
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I recently got JellyBean myself and I'm really in love with the enhanced notifications it offers. Now me and @vdesmet93 both agree that notifications in andlytics are slightly disappointing (even before JB really). It would be very nice to be able to at least configure the sound that is used. Right now it uses the default. Second of all, as JellyBean has well very nice notification options it would be great if these got used. We would like a graph or table with info (input on this is appreciated), and maybe a certain use for the actions?

I also took a look at the code around the notification, which is really disappointing imo (I don't think any of you wrote it, so don't feel offended). Notifications are still created the old way. This should be done as introduced in 3.0, through the builder. For this however I highly recommend https://github.com/JakeWharton/NotificationCompat2 as it goes back just as far as the NotificationCompat builder in the support library, but has support for JellyBean notifications.

I'd like input on this, I'm willing to do the actual implementation of it.

title: No proper coding rules
body: After I messed with the code a bit and contributed some stuff I noticed one fairly annoying thing. The coding style is different like every where. I mean in the one part of a file it's all tabs, in another part of the same file it's 2 space as indentations, then it's 4 again. This is rather annoying. I think I would be a very good thing for everyone if someone made proper rules for this and re factored the entire repository to match these rules.

title: Hide AdMob action items when AdMob isn't setup
Adjusted menu items to fit better on phones in landscape mode...
body: and provided a tablet menu that matches a phone in portrait

title: Global and account specific preferences
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is for #103 but also introduces a few other prefrence related improvements.

This will reset (ignore) any prefrences that are now global so users will have to set them up again, I think this is OK if we put it in the changelog.

Ideally give it a test, but at a minimum, give it a quick once over. It appears to work fine for me, but just to be sure.

title: Added the loading spinner on place of the refresh button in the ActionBar, as discussed in #141
body:
This looks a lot better than the default infinite progressbar in ABS,
as it appears on the action item. This has a small downside when in
landscape though. As it can't show the text when it has an ActionView,
in some cases it'll have 'enough room' to show both the export and import
action items. Causing the account picker to be a tad smaller in some cases.
In my opinion the import and export shouldn't even be in the ActionBar as
they aren't exactly features a user uses a lot.

title: Size of Progress Indicator
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It's my opinion that the current progress indicator is absurdly large.

According to the android action bar [guidelines](https://developer.android.com/guide/practices/ui_guidelines/icon_design_action_bar.html#size11) the icons should be 36x36, for hdpi (which I'm developing on). The currently used [progress bitmap](https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/blob/master/actionbarsherlock/res/drawable-hdpi/abs__spinner_48_outer_holo.png) is 72x72, and for example the [refresh icon](https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/blob/master/res/drawable-hdpi/icon_refresh.png) is 48x48.

So my question is, was it a conscious decision to systematically use larger icons? I have to confess the refresh icon has a very usable size, and doubt that a smaller icon would work. But why is the progress indicator so large?

title: Logout button should be removed
body:
On the main screen, there's a logout button. The only thing it does is reverting back to the account-chooser activity, which is exactly the same as pressing the back button. 
I think it should be removed, or placed in the action overflow menu.

title: NPE QuickFix for onScroll in GalleryActivity
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: NPE Fix for testing purposes

title: write directly to zip file and don't try to open local CSV files
body: Should fix import from menu error.

title: Zipped export -- write directly to zip file
body: Don't try to open local CSV files.

title: Zipped export -- added account name to zip file name
body:
By popular demand the current account name is no included in the zip file name. This will be used when importing to associate with an account. If finding the account name from file name fails, the default account (from preferences is used). It does check whether package names match the current account, so there shouldn't be any accidents... Export is now an activity too, and import loads much faster since it doesn't try to pull all available data. 

I don't multiple real dev accounts, so please test it.

title: Stats changes not visualized in main view during the first day
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I get notifications for changes but they don't get visualized / shown anymore in the main view. 

Comment added and shown in the comment activity but no +1 in the main view, activating +- changes everything stays on 0.

title: Refactor base activities
body:
Extending on the work originally done to reduce duplicated code (BaseChartActivity), this futher cleans up the activities a bit to try and get rid of anything from the super classes that is no use to the activity on display. At the weekend I plan on doing a bit more, especailly around the async tasks/data loading in general.

 Added a new BaseDetailsActitity and moved all the code from BaseActivity that is used in the details views (Comments, Downloads etc...) into the new activity. This also allowed some duplicated code from the CommentsActivity, AdmobActivity etc to be removed. LoginActivity no longer extends BaseActivity as it has no need to. I'm also using Utils.execute() for some tasks to avoid a delay on HC+ when switching accounts and when scrolling through apps during the initial load.

title: Implements exporting/importing stats in a zip file.
body:
This makes some incompatible changes, see below:
- stats are now exported in a single zip file, andlytics.zip
- the import dialog is now an activity
- the import activity handles zip files, so if try to open a zip file, you can specify the Andlytics
- import/export services are now IntentServices
- Tapping on the 'export complete' notification brings up the Share dialog so you can easily send the file to Dropbox, email, etc
  - Finally, since the bottom action bar has some space now, the export/import icons are shown be default. We can argue about this if you don't like it :)
  - Not directly related, but consider using Utils.execute(task) when you want to make sure an AsyncTask executes in parallel with others (since HC, execute() by default executes tasks serially)

title: In-app changelog is only in English
label: [Label(name="docs & advertising")]
body: Now Android app has a nice popup dialog with the changelog, but it is available only in English. We are using GetLocalization for the translations, and this is going pretty well. Actually, changelogs for Google Play are already translated through it (well, sometimes they are a bit outdated). Maybe we could display localized changelogs inside the app too? Like with other string resources, falling back to English if there is no translated version? Please share your ideas.

title: Use the admob account layout in the admob activity
New account management
body:
This does a few things to improve account management #124 (there is certainly more work to be done though):

If a user only has 1 google account, they no longer need to select that account each time, and simply see the account name as the subtitle in the main view. They can use Menu->Manage accounts, to add a new one.

If a user has more then 1 google account, once they select an account on the first run, they do not have to select an account each time. Instead they have a drop down selector to pick which account they want as is done in Gmail etc... They can use Menu->Manage accounts to add a new one. You can also untick an account which disables syncing and hides it from the drop down I'm using this myself for my work account which is google based.

It also replaces the bottom bar (fixes #99) with a spit action bar which shows the percentage/daily change action item and refresh. Logout option has been removed as it is now redundant.

title: Development strategy
body:
As we are at the mercy of google making API changes, it would probably be best to make sure that life is as painless as possible when we have to implement a fix i.e. no unfinished code/anything we don't want to release just yet in the master.

I guess at a minimum that would mean have the master branch and a dev/next branch. Whenever an API fix is made, do it in the master and then merge that into dev. Everything else should be done in the dev branch, and merged back into the master once we are ready to do a release. That way  we know (apart from API changes), that there is nothing unfinished/untested that needs to be reviewed before making a quick fix release.

Any thoughts? Especailly from those more familure with git and the best way to do this?

title: Fix dutch terms and spelling
body: Fix dutch spelling errors and improve certain terms

title: Git help :(
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
So....

I had a branch I was working on (aren't I good :)), however I've actidentily pushed the commits from that branch into my master when trying to update a commit in that branch. What is the best way to revert that so that my new changes are only in my branch and not in my master. Additionally, my master has a slightly revised version of the last commit over my branch, how do I get that into the branch.

Thanks.

title: Re-implement switching between and managing accounts
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:

title: Release v2.1.0
body:
Hi everybody!

We all made some decent progress on the feature set of Andlytics and I agree with @willlunniss that a new public release on the market will be good to show that we are making process for those not checking gitbub. 

I just updated all the translation files so we should be good to go.

A Tag has been created: https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/tags (Thanks @willlunniss for pointing that out!)

So the preparation is done.

@willlunniss @devwom @nelenkov @fda77 @easye1161 - Please vote if you think we should release 2.1.0

My impression is that this got broken with the new preferences but that is just a guess. @willlunniss would you mind checking? The new "preferences" probably don't get picked up everywhere.

Has anyone considered having a matching web service for this stuff?  

I know that we have the developer console...and that they are planning to release a new dev console which may or may not have more features...but still...its something to consider, even if its a self hosted thing that users have to setup on their own if they want it.  Would obviously require that the stat exports have an option to basically ftp to a set spot on their server.

Just an idea

title: Preferences are on a per account basis
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
See https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues/46 for full details. In summary, The current implementation appends the account name to each preference key thus making them seperate for each account that a user sets up in the app.

The question is, which preferences should be moved to be global, and which if any should be kept how they are.

The following is @AndyScherzinger point of view:

> Account settings vs. app wide settings really needs to be discussed. I checked and Andlytics treated every thing on an account level. I am not sure if people really want to have different notification setting per account. At least I don't don't :)
> 
> I guess most people never realized this since most of them have one account only. In my personal opinion the only thing that should be account specific is the "apps to hide" setting. Everything else looks app wide to me.
> 
> Any comments anyone?

While thinking about this, it is also worth considering how we will work with multiple accounts in general to replace the current and not great implementation of logging in and out using the back button.

title: Code Style Guidelines
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
At a minimum we should decide on:
Intent: Tabs/spaces - appears to be tabs atm
Line length: 100 chars? - no particular one atm
Variable names: currently class wide private/static ones are not differentiated, I'm personally a big fan of AOSP mPrivate sStatic but moving to that would require changing the existing code as it is modified which is a bit of a pain. So it might be worth sticking with what it is for now.

title: Use app name for subtitle rather than package name
body: After using it for a bit I think this should be the default rather than package name. Once a propper settings activity is in place we can add an option to control it.

title: Display the App's name from Google Play rather than the APK
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: See https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues/95 for background

title: Remove the bottom bar on the main screen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be reallly nice to get rid of the bar with the logout and &/+- toggle. Logout is easy, it should be an action item with 'never' set.

%/+- toggle is harder because I guess it should be constantly visible in the action bar which is OK, except quite a few devices are limited to 2 action items in portrait mode and the forced overflow menu counts as one. This can be fixed by using the default menu panel on < 3.0 (don't use .ForceOverflow style) except we will need to provide alternative icons for any item that could be displayed in eirther the aciton bar, or overflow menu. This is possible by using an internal class in ABS (although because it is internal it isn't officially supported) to detect if an item is on the action bar during onCreateOptionsMenu. I have used this in one of my apps and it worked very nicely. And if support is removed for it down the line, well we can deal with it then.

At the moment this isn't needed, but if we set Import/Export to be isRoom|withText, then it will be needed for them.

Thoughts?

title: Added build.xml to ActionBarSherlock to fully build it with ant
Identifying the currently selected app
body:
At the moment it is no longer possible to work out which app you are viewing stats for. Previously you could see the app's icon in the top left corner.

My ideal solution would be to return the app's icon to the top left and or stick the package name as the subtitle in the action bar and in the case where there is a subtitle at the moment, promote that to be the main title. I would also like to see the package name in a slightly grey colour as it generally used on a dark actionbar.

I'm more than happy to do this, however I seem to remember a brief talk about it (but cannot remember which issue it was in), so wanted to bring it up before going ahead.

title: Inconsitant use of lowercase/sentence case
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I've just been checking out the WIP ActionBarSherlock work and it looks great, except the use of lowercase text stands out even more than it did before.
Looking around the app, it uses mostly lowercase text, with some sentence case. In keeping with the general move towards the design standards, it would be nice to make it all consistant by updating the bits that should be sentense case (pretty much everything except X comments, X total downloads, X active installs etc...). Additionally, some strings could be changed, e.g. 'Import'/'Export'.

I've brought this up now, rather than waiting for the ABS work to finish because I thought that if it is decided that it should be changed, it should probably be done sooner rather than later to save on fixing the translations.

Anyway, any thoughts on this? (I'm happy to do the monkey work, but will have to get my head around git first though.)

title: Notifications for stat changes on first load?
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I noticed something when I had to reinstall the app on my phone.  During the first day you have the app, you don't get any notifications or stat changes.  Just a guess, but I'm assuming that it is tracking those changes based on the info from the previous day.  I would suggest that there be another check in there for first runs of the app.  It would check the info from the dev console the first time the app is run and store that just like it would a previous day's info.  That way stats and notifications operate properly the first day you have the app running.  I only noticed this because I happened to remember what the comment count was for one of my apps and I noticed that there was a new comment/rating that I didn't get notified about.

Along the same lines, what do you think about making some sort of visual cue of updated/new comments and ratings when you manually go into the app?  Say...the border around each app's info box would be thicker and would be a different color, like red or the blue highlight color....something.  That would clear either when you click on something in that app or when you move away from the app.  The benefit here would be, like I said, when you go into the app and it updates, sees that there is a new comment and/or rating change and gives you a clear representation of that.  Otherwise, as it is...unless you happen to know what the ratings/comments count were before you went into the app or you happened to see it change after it updates, you may not notice the updated info.  Basically, the only visual and audio cure of something new/updated is the notifications.

title: Notification API?
body:
Heya,

Is there a set API for the notifications?  I have an app that we want to create a plugin for that will allow for highly customizable notifications.  We are in the process of developing several plugins and this is one I wanna do.  Once plugged into our app, it would let you set app specific popup/audible notifications.  Say you want to definitely be notified about a specific app, but not necessarily others...then you set a custom alert.  Or of course, general alerts.

Anywho...feel free to check out the app.  Proceeds are going to a cancer patient in need, so it isn't a total shameless promotion.

title: Integrate ActionBarSherlock
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: See subject. This will help with ICS design and make the preference screen (to be implemented) a lot nicer and also help implementing a nice way for a user switch and adding accounts.

title: Multiple versions of Andlytics now?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
If you go to Google Play and search for Andlytics, you'll find a few versions now.  I even saw a blue version that looked oddly like some of the preview mockups in one of the threads here.  This was bound to happen since it went open source...but right now, it seems that they are all exactly the same.

I think that if this group wants to stand out from the rest, there needs to be clear organization.  There also needs to be a major change in the UI and function that will make this version stand out above the rest.  

Now I have pointed out a few UI flaws and I would like to reiterate some now.  First, the settings...  Honestly that has always bothered me...how they aren't in a menu and that they are lacking (especially with notifications).  Then the whole tile layout that is there now.  On a phone, it just isn't optimal or a good use of space.  I can see it as being great for both widgets and as an UI for tablets, but not phones.  Would be great to have a consolidated, well organized screen.  Put the settings into an actual settings screen.  A lot of what is there can be icon-ized to save space and if a user wants a more detailed view, rather than doing that slide expansion effect, save resources and it can be its own screen.  Just clear, concise info on the main screen.  Some have countered that observation by stating that they like having it all on screen like it is, but still...whether you click to slide open or click to view...you're still clicking.  It wouldn't save you any time.  Again here is my quick mockup to represent something like a concise list: www.spiderflystudios.com/files/andlyticslist.png

You'd get and see all of the same information, its just compacted to save space.  If I knew how to program for Android or if my dev had the time for another project other than our own, then we'd be doing it, but you guys already are...no need for yet another rendition of the app.  With that said, if someone here would like some design advice/help, just message me.  I believe in this project and am willing to donate my time to help.

P.S. - The app icon that shows up on Google Play doesn't match the icon you see on your device, its flipped.  Would also suggest a new, unique icon for the app to differentiate this version from the others.  Here is one I did...if you wanna use it, you're free to.  If you have a suggestion for something else, lemme know and I'll see what I can do, but I think that this one is enough like the original for users to recognize it, but different enough that they'll know it isn't the same.  :)
www.spiderflystudios.com/files/andlytics.png

title: Crash just after install (NoSuchFieldError)
body:
Hello everyone:

First of all, thanks for all the hard work.

However, it seems that, at least in my device, Andlytics crashes just after install. When I try to open it, it force-closes, the stacktrace shows: "NoSuchFieldError: SILENT".

I think this is an issue which only happens when signing the application (thus, using ProGuard), as stated here: http://code.google.com/p/acra/issues/detail?id=22

I had some of these errors with my own apps, and I think that you did the same mistake as me (publishing a signed version without installing it first :P)

However, if it is not the case, and you need more info, my setup is a Samsung Galaxy S (I9000) with CyanogenMod 9.

Regards and again, thanks for all the hard work!

-Eduard.

title: Feature wishlist...
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
As someone who has used the app for quite some time...here's my feature wishlist...

Enhance the UI...
- By continuing the trend of moving it over to the aOS 4+ UI standards.
- Move the settings to an actual settings menu area.
- Change the method of switching accounts to something more intuitive.  Right now if you are on the main screen viewing your list of apps, when you hit the back button it takes you to a list of the google accounts attached to the phone.  Why not add Andlytics as sync option and only those accounts in which you have Andlytics syncing turned on for will show up.  IN regards to hitting the back button and being taken to that screen...it just isn't intuitive and doesn't make sense.  It should exit the app like it does with every other app.  For account switching, something like how the gmail app does it would be nice.
- Get rid of the admob tab as for many devs it service no purpose other than wasting space.  Make it a plugin, an optional install for users.  Then more plugins could be made for those who use other ad services.....but not every dev puts ads in their apps.
- Make the main screen you go to more of a dashboard.  It would show the app icon for each app you have.  Clicking on it would take you to a screen that shows all that info.  Right now they all come off as more of a widget look and feel.  Which would be great for an actual widget.
- Give more notification options....like choosing the LED color...vibration...choosing a specific sound, etc.
- Either integrate Google Checkout info or make it a plugin as well.

Thats just some of what I would like and hope to see based on my usage and what I've heard or read others said about their experience with the app.

title: Auto-update or auto-infer GWT data
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I have two ideas to resolve the GWT data change in a permanent or semi-permanent way:

Auto-update (semi-permanent): there's no need to relase a new APK when GWT data changes, all we need to update are a couple of String vars now defined as constants in DeveloperConsole.java. We could make them non constant and auto-update them pulling from a central Andlytics server every time they change. This would still require manual effort of developers to fix the strings but updates would be immediate for all users.

Auto-infer (permanent): those strings are actually written in the main console page so I think it should be possible to infer that from the html of that page.

This latter strategy would be implemented as this:
- save the GWT strings in preferences
- if something goes wrong infer the new strings and update preferences
- try again

the Xsrf tokens can be inferred by the userInfo object in https://play.google.com/apps/publish/Home

don't have a solution yet for GET_FULL_ASSET_INFO_FOR_USER_REQUEST, GET_ASSET_FOR_USER_COUNT_REQUEST, GET_USER_COMMENTS_REQUEST, GET_FEEDBACK_OVERVIEW that are probably build at runtime using javascript

the final solution would be automate Chrome to gather those urls ;)

title: Fixes some layout lint warnings
body: See [Issue 14](https://github.com/Andlytics-Project/andlytics/issues/14) for details. Fixing errors as reported by lint in ADT 20 preview 3.

title: New package name?
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Which package name we should use? com.github.andlytics-project is not allowed. Is com.github.andlytics okay?

title: Support for Multi Developer Account
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Basic support is done, but need to do more to really finish this properly
- [x] Fetch apps for multi-developer accounts
- [ ] UI for switching between different consoles/filtering
- [ ] Refactor the DB

title: Shared error reports
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: ACRA reports by default go to a Google spreadsheet. Add a new spreadsheet and share it to major contributors. Even better, set it up to report errors to BugSense (they have free accounts for open source projects) and add multiple watchers.

title: Update libraries
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The ACRA and achartengine versions are quite old. Update to latest ones, and fix any issues.

title: Fix lint warnings and make it compatible with latest ADT
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Add @TargetApi to AutoSyncHandlerLevel8 and fix layout, etc. related warnings.

title: The stats content provider is public
body: Any app can now connect to it and export or overwrite your stats. This is probably something we don't want. Requiring a signature based permission is probably a good idea. Alternatively, the CP itself might check who to caller is and grant/deny access or just make it private for now, so it can only be used from the within the app.

title: Release strategy?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
How should we release andlytics in Google Play?
Until there is a solution, I publish "Andlytics OPEN"
